results.title: Why unions?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Mark Zannis, Barrie Howells, Laura Alper and Laszlo Barna
results.brief_description: Using bank employees in British Columbia and employees of the Michelin Tire Company in Nova Scotia as case studies, this film argues that blue- and white-collar workers can benefit from unionization. It offers a condensed version of the information provided in Who Wants Unions, and in addition includes comments by United Auto Workers’ President Bob White on the benefits realized by both unionized and non-union workers as a result of the union movement. A good overview for those already knowledgeable about labor issues.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Mark Zannis, Barrie Howells, Laura Alper and Laszlo Barna

results.title: Why two numbers
results.creator_credit: Jayne Mooney, Noel O'Brien, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The O’Brien family have served in the army since the 1800s. Noel O’Brien, himself a member of the service, delves into the military history of his family and, in particular, of his father. Francis Charles O’Brien had two regimental numbers to his name and Noel wanted to find out the reason. As a result, he discovers something of his father’s personality, a larrikin who got himself into trouble, but was courageous enough to always be there for his mates.

results.title: Why tractors overturn
results.creator_credit: Frank North, A. Frank Bundy, Great Britain. Ministry of Agriculture and Wallace
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Farming”.
Illustrates how tractor accidents occur and the wisest way of avoiding them. With a demonstration tractor, officers of the National Institute of Agricultural Engineering give instruction on correct tractor usage. Made with co-operation of Massey-Ferguson, Joseph Lucas Ltd.

results.title: Why the emu cannot fly
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson, Educational Media Australia and Australian National University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Aboriginal legends”.
This film is illustrated by drawings of an Aboriginal legend from the book “Djugurba: tales from the Spirit Time” and tells how the emu’s vanity about his beautiful wings brings about his downfall.

results.title: Why take chances
results.creator_credit: Sid Davis Productions and Sid Davis
results.brief_description: A safety film combining wacky animated scenes of children in pain with real life footage of the same thing. Careless kids are the focus and as with most other Sid Davis safety films, the examples sited usually end in tragic cumuppence. Jimmy, the star of this film, runs into a tree, steps on a rusty nail, flies a kite in a rainstorm and gets buried alive. The narrator says: “Too bad.”

results.title: Why study latin?
results.brief_description: A visit to high school Latin class where the teacher and several of the students explain why studying Latin is important to them. The film covers the values of Latin to an understanding of history, an appreciation of literature and a mastering of English, and the practical usefulness of Latin to many professions including those of law and medicine.

results.title: Why study insects?
results.brief_description: Focuses on the work undertaken by Australian National Insect Collection in Canberra where insects from all parts of Australia are studied. Explains why it is important to understand the behaviour of insects. The production does not provide descriptions of insects, rather the processing of information.

results.title: Why rock the boat?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, William Weintraub and John Howe
results.brief_description: William Weintraub’s romantic comedy, based on his novel of the same title, about the Montreal newspaper world of the 1940s. Stuart Gillard plays the innocent, bashful, yet ambitious young reporter, fresh from McGill, eager to move from academia into the mainstream of life and love. His initiation takes many an unexpected and hilarious turn. Cast includes Stuart Gillard, Sean Sullivan, Patricia Gage.

results.title: Why punctuate?
results.brief_description: Designed to help the teacher to introduce pupils to the study of punctuation, or to help revise the study of punctuation, this film presents the most important punctuation marks, and the basic rules for their use so that pupils’ interest will be aroused and their study of the subject motivated.
